problem.p: What will be the value of the following Boolean expression in Java?

div.p: Floating point numbers are not represented precisely in a computer. Therefore, the result "0.01" obtained from multiplying 0.1 to 0.1 is different from the "0.01" represented by 0.01 directly.

If we wish to test for equality between two floating point numbers, we may find the absolute difference between the two numbers and check to see if this difference is smaller than a threshold, e.g. 0.0001.
